name: Splice Machine Training / About / Our Training Classes

paragraphs.text:
%md # Our Training Classes Splice Machine offers automated training classes using interactive Apache Zeppelin notebooks. Before starting any of these classes, please spend 20 minutes or so reviewing the [Splice Machine Basics](/#/notebook/2DX2STBE7) and [Zeppelin Notebook Basics](/#/notebook/2DV36AEJ2) to gain a basic understanding of how Splice Machine works, and to learn how to use the Zeppelin notebooks that constitute our training classes. These notebooks are found in our *Basic Training* folder. Each of our training classes is housed in its own curriculum folder:
Class Target Audience Prerequisites Time to Complete
Basic Training Please review the two notebooks in this folder before starting any Splice Machine Training class. No Prerequisites 20-30 minutes
Splice Machine Developers, Part I Query writers, ETL processors, developers Experience with SQL and some programming experience with Python or Scala 1-2 hours
Splice Machine Developers, Part II Query writers, ETL processors, developers Completion of Splice Machine Developers, Part I 2-3 hours
Data Science with Splice Machine Data Engineers and Data Scientists Experience with SQL, and some programming experience with Python or Scala. You should also have experience with implementing Machine Learning, data transformation, data analysis, streaming, model design and selection, and results interpretation. 2-3 hours
Splice Machine for DBAs DBAs and Application Support Specialists Experience with databases. 2-3 hours

msg.data:
Our Training Classes

Splice Machine offers automated training classes using interactive Apache Zeppelin notebooks.

Before starting any of these classes, please spend 20 minutes or so reviewing the Splice Machine Basics and Zeppelin Notebook Basics to gain a basic understanding of how Splice Machine works, and to learn how to use the Zeppelin notebooks that constitute our training classes. These notebooks are found in our Basic Training folder.

Each of our training classes is housed in its own curriculum folder:

Class Target Audience Prerequisites Time to Complete
Basic Training Please review the two notebooks in this folder before starting any Splice Machine Training class. No Prerequisites 20-30 minutes
Splice Machine Developers, Part I Query writers, ETL processors, developers Experience with SQL and some programming experience with Python or Scala 1-2 hours
Splice Machine Developers, Part II Query writers, ETL processors, developers Completion of Splice Machine Developers, Part I 2-3 hours
Data Science with Splice Machine Data Engineers and Data Scientists Experience with SQL, and some programming experience with Python or Scala. You should also have experience with implementing Machine Learning, data transformation, data analysis, streaming, model design and selection, and results interpretation. 2-3 hours
Splice Machine for DBAs DBAs and Application Support Specialists Experience with databases. 2-3 hours
